The following code below is used for my own reference to pull the correct timeframes from online.
```{r cars}
electionDates <- c("1980-11-4", "1984-11-6", "1988-11-8", "1992-11-3", "1996-11-5", "2000-11-7", "2004-11-2", "2008-11-4", "2012-11-6", "2016-11-8")
initData <- as.Date(electionDates) - 90 # this is the date that we will begin tracking the market (also the date that is 3 months before the election for that corresponding year). we will track for a month after the election date.
postData <- as.Date(electionDates) + 30
initData
postData
```


```{r}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))


returnsOverTime1980 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "1980")
returnsOverTime1984 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "1984")
returnsOverTime1988 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "1988")
returnsOverTime1992 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "1992")
returnsOverTime1996 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "1996")
returnsOverTime2000 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "2000")
returnsOverTime2004 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "2004")
returnsOverTime2008 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "2008")
returnsOverTime2012 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "2012")
returnsOverTime2016 <- read_excel("electionsp500.xlsx", sheet = "2016")

winners <- c("1980R", "1984R", "1988R", "1992D", "1996D", "2000R", "2004R", "2008D", "2012D", "2016R" )

#Graphs
graphOfReturns1980 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime1980, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "red")
graphOfReturns1984 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime1984, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "red")
graphOfReturns1988 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime1988, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "red")
graphOfReturns1992 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime1992, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "blue")
graphOfReturns1996 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime1996, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "blue")
graphOfReturns2000 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime2000, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "red")
graphOfReturns2004 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime2004, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "red")
graphOfReturns2008 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime2008, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "blue")
graphOfReturns2012 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime2012, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "blue")
graphOfReturns2016 <- ggplot(data = returnsOverTime2016, aes(x = date, y = return)) + geom_smooth(method=lm, color = "red")

graphOfReturns1980
graphOfReturns1984
graphOfReturns1988
graphOfReturns1992
graphOfReturns1996
graphOfReturns2000

graphOfReturns2016
```

```{r}
#Linear Models
linear1980 <- lm(return ~ dateNum, data = returnsOverTime1980)
linear1984 <- lm(return ~ dateNum, data = returnsOverTime1984)
linear1988 <- lm(return ~ dateNum, data = returnsOverTime1988)
linear1992 <- lm(return ~ dateNum, data = returnsOverTime1992)
linear1996 <- lm(return ~ dateNum, data = returnsOverTime1996)
linear2000 <- lm(return ~ dateNum, data = returnsOverTime2000)




summary(linear1980)
coefficients(linear1980)[2] * 100 * 30
coefficients(linear1984)[2] * 100 * 30
coefficients(linear1988)[2] * 100 * 30
coefficients(linear1992)[2] * 100 * 30
coefficients(linear1996)[2] * 100 * 30
coefficients(linear2000)[2] * 100 * 30
```
